meanings.definition: Pompous or pretentious in speech or manner.
meanings.sent1: His orotund speech annoyed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent2: The politician's orotund promises failed to convince the voters.
meanings.sent3: The orotund professor's lectures put everyone to sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her orotund attitude made her seem out of touch with reality.
meanings.sent5: The orotund language used by the lawyer confused the jury.

meanings.definition: Full, round, and imposing in sound.
meanings.sent1: The orotund voice of the opera singer filled the entire hall.
meanings.sent2: The orotund music of the orchestra captivated the audience.
meanings.sent3: The orotund sound of the bell echoed through the valley.
meanings.sent4: His orotund laughter could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent5: The orotund roar of the lion sent shivers down our spines.

meanings.definition: Characterized by fullness, strength, and richness of sound.
meanings.sent1: The orotund tones of the cello resonated beautifully in the concert hall.
meanings.sent2: The orotund quality of her singing voice impressed the judges.
meanings.sent3: The orotund notes of the piano filled the room with warmth.
meanings.sent4: His orotund speech carried a sense of authority and confidence.
meanings.sent5: The orotund melody of the symphony left the audience in awe.
